intro: Kedrostis leloja, commonly known as the African burr grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems, lobed leaves, and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a spiny, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Kedrostis leloja is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments.
